componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Business Driver


Business Driver is anyone driving for work purposes, other than to their normal place of work. Working to customers/ suppliers/ trade shows / other colleagues' home offices could be classed as 'Business Driving'. For the avoidance of doubt, we advise all drivers to obtain Business Driving Insurance and Majenta will reimburse all reasonable additional costs for this.


If you have ticked that you are a business driver, upload the relevant files under the documents tab (top of screen) including Car Insurance Document, Proof of MOT and Road Tax.

  • Once files have been uploaded, tick "Insurance Updated", "MOT Updated" and "Convictions Updated" where necessary and enter the renewal dates.


PLEASE ALSO NOTE: It is advisable to have a first aid kit, blanket, and a bottle of water in your car in case of emergencies.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Holiday Policy

To request a holiday, please create a new record above which will be sent to your manager for approval.


Holiday Requests

Minimum of 4 weeks notice for a holiday of 1 week or more. The holiday year runs 1st Jan until 31st Dec.

Use the Calendar below to view you and your teams' approved holidays, alongside bank holidays and Majenta events such as wellbeing days.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Absence Policy

If you need to log an absence from work, please create a new record above.


Sick Leave 


If you cannot attend work because you are ill or injured, you should telephone your line manager no later than 10:00am and create an absence record above as early as possible. The following details should be provided:

(a) The nature of your illness, (b) the expected length of your absence from work, (c) contact details (d) any outstanding or urgent work that requires attention.


Evidence of sickness: For sickness absence of between four and seven calendar days you must complete a self-certification form which is available from your line manager. For absence of more than a week you must obtain a certificate from your doctor (a "Statement of Fitness for Work") stating that you are not fit for work and the reason(s) why.


Sick pay: You would normally only be entitled to Statutory Sick Pay, and normal pay is only paid at the discretion of you line manager or a Director.


Further details on Sickness Absence Policy is available in your Employment Contract and or the Company Staff Handbook.


Compassionate / Bereavement Leave


Compassionate leave is designed to help an employee where they need to deal with necessary arrangements for or assist a close relative who is seriously or critically ill. Bereavement leave is designed to help an employee cope with the death of a close relative, to deal with necessary arrangements and attend their funeral.


Employees are entitled to take compassionate / bereavement leave of up to five days in any 12-month period in respect of a spouse or partner, child, stepchild, grandchild, parent, stepparent, parent-in-law, grandparent, brother or sister, stepbrother or stepsister, or brother or sister-in-law.


An employee who is unable to return to work following a period of compassionate / bereavement leave should contact their line manager. It may be appropriate to take a period of annual leave or unpaid leave in those circumstances.


Requesting compassionate/ bereavement leave: We recognise that it may not always be possible to request compassionate / bereavement leave in advance. However, where it is possible, you should make a request to your line manager. You should tell them about the reasons for your request and the number of days leave you would like to take.


Where it is not possible to request leave in advance you should contact your line manager as soon as possible to tell them the reason for your absence and the number of days you expect to be absent.


Maternity Leave 


You have a right to take up to a year of maternity leave. It doesn’t matter how long you’ve worked Majenta.


How to get your maternity leave: At least 15 weeks before the week when your baby’s due, please either let your line manager know and email hr@majentasolutions.com. Let them know: 

(a) that you’re pregnant, (b) when your baby’s due (c) that you want to take maternity leave (d) when you want your maternity leave to start and end (you can change these dates later).


HR will confirm the end date of your maternity leave. HR will ask to see a medical certificate, such as your MATB1 form. You’ll get this at an antenatal appointment after your 20-week scan. 


In respect of Maternity Pay, please contact HR and they will inform you of your entitlement.  


Paternity Leave


Paternity leave gives new parents 2 weeks off work. You can start the leave any time in the first 6 months after the baby's birth. You can also take paternity leave when you adopt a child. Please notify your line manager and email hr@majentasolutions.com at least 4 weeks of the birth of your child and confirm when you are planning to take the Paternity Leave. 


In respect of Paternity Pay, please contact HR and they will inform you of your entitlement
